info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 9:56PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Livingston, Ford and southwestern Iroquois Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 953 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms in McLean County moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Paxton, Gibson City, Buckley, Melvin, Loda, Roberts, Elliott, Sibley, Strawn and Clarence. Including the following interstate... I-57 between mile markers 258 and 275. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for central Illinois.
